triples.name: Evolutionary game theory
triples.relevance: Core theoretical framework for analyzing strategy evolution and population dynamics in competitive environments.

triples.name: Prisoner's dilemma
triples.relevance: Fundamental game-theoretic model that captures the tension between individual incentives and collective welfare that motivates cooperation studies.

triples.name: Birthâ€“death process
triples.relevance: Stochastic process model used as one of the update rules to simulate population dynamics and strategy transitions.

triples.name: Moran process
triples.relevance: Stochastic population model related to the death-birth update rule for tracking evolutionary dynamics in finite populations.

triples.name: Network topology
triples.relevance: Mathematical representation of how lattice structures organize spatial interactions between individuals in the population.

triples.name: Evolutionary dynamics
triples.relevance: Paper contributes new insights into how environmental feedback and network structure influence evolutionary dynamics under different update mechanisms.

triples.name: Graph theory
triples.relevance: Mathematical foundation underlying the representation of lattice networks as graphs with vertices and edges.

triples.name: Cooperation
triples.relevance: Key behavioral outcome studied in the paper as a strategy that varies with environmental conditions and network structure.
